data.title: Tommy Savas: Movies, Photos, Videos, News, Biography & Birthday
data.meta_description: Tommy Savas: Check out the list of all Tommy Savas movies along with photos, videos, biography and birthday. Also find latest Tommy Savas news on Times of India.
data.text:
Jay Shah elected unopposed as next ICC chairman

timesofindia.com / Aug 27, 2024, 20:35 (IST)

Jay Shah has been elected unopposed as the next Independent Chair of the International Cricket Council (ICC), succeeding Greg Barclay on December 1, 2024. Shah, currently BCCI Honorary Secretary and Chair of the Asian Cricket Council, aims to globalize cricket, balance multiple formats, and capitalize on cricket's inclusion in the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics.

'Every person has ...': Haryana CM distances himself, BJP from Kangana's remarks

timesofindia.com / Aug 27, 2024, 18:43 (IST)

Haryana chief minister Nayab Saini has distanced himself and the BJP from Kangana Ranaut's controversial statements concerning the farmers' protests. Saini reaffirmed the party's dedication to farmers' welfare. Himachal Pradesh officials heavily criticized Ranaut, prompting the BJP to clarify that Ranaut is not permitted to speak on policy matters.

Rajya Sabha bypolls: Here is list of candidates who won unopposed

timesofindia.com / Aug 27, 2024, 20:41 (IST)

BJP and NDA leaders have been elected unopposed to the Rajya Sabha from several states including Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Bihar, Haryana, Assam, and Maharashtra. This follows the resignation of previous incumbents who were elected to the Lok Sabha. The elections saw significant victories for these political entities, marking critical appointments in the Indian political landscape.

'You cannot pick and choose ... ': SC on 'fairness' of probe agencies during Kavitha's bail hearing

timesofindia.com / Aug 27, 2024, 19:50 (IST)

The Supreme Court granted bail to BRS leader K Kavitha, questioning the fairness of central agencies' investigations in the Delhi excise policy scam. After Kavitha had been jailed for over five months, the court noted that further custody was unnecessary as investigations were complete. She was ordered to furnish bail bonds of Rs 10 lakh in each case.

Serial rapes, betrayal, entrapment: The 90s scandal that rocked Ajmer

tnn / Aug 26, 2024, 12:48 (IST)

A trial that lasted 32 years came to an end last week when a POCSO court in Ajmer sentenced six men to life in prison. These were the last of 18 men who were convicted for a series of horrifying crimes committed from 1989 until police action began in May, 1992

Juli Vavilova: Telegram CEO's 'girlfriendâ€™ who accompanied him on his arrest journey

timesofindia.com / Aug 27, 2024, 19:56 (IST)

Telegram CEO Pavel Durov has been arrested in France, accompanied by 24-year-old Juli Vavilova, a Dubai-based crypto coach and streamer. It is speculated that Vavilova's frequent social media posts may have disclosed Durov's location, leading to his arrest. Authorities have not confirmed Vavilova's involvement or whether she is an agent.

Actor Darshan VIP treatment: How phones are smuggled into prisons with stealth & help from staff

tnn / Aug 27, 2024, 19:30 (IST)

In Karnataka, the smuggling of phones and drugs into prisons remains a problem. Undertrial detainees, visitors, and insiders engage in covert tactics to bring in contraband, like bribery and hiding in delivery vehicles. Demand for phones is high, with inmates renting them out and corrupt staff facilitating transactions, indicating systemic issues within the prison system.

Fadnavis says collapsed Shivaji statue built by Navy as Oppn blames govt

timesofindia.com / Aug 27, 2024, 18:25 (IST)

The Navy, not Maharashtra state government, constructed the 35-foot Shivaji statue in Sindhudurg which collapsed, deputy CM Fadnavis said, while blaming inadequate local factor considerations and stated plans for a bigger statue. Opposition, led by Aaditya Thackeray, criticized the ruling BJP, alleging corruption and hasty installation before elections.
